alert.note: Alert for Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 8:31AM CDT until July 07 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Oklahoma, Dewey, Ellis, Major and Woodward. In western Oklahoma, Custer and Roger Mills. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Taloga, Thomas, Seiling, Leedey, Camargo, Oakwood, Putnam, Angora, Moorewood, Cestos, Chester, Roll, Orion, Crawford, Fay, northwestern Canton Lake, Durham and Hucmac. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
